p: In summary, five beta-rhizobial species, especially Cupriavidus genotype II, with great genetic diversity as the dominant microsymbionts and three Rhizobium species as minor microsymbionts for M. pudica and M. diplotricha plants were detected in a vast sampling area in China. Most of them have been found in both the invasive regions and the centers of origin of these plants, but Cupriavidus genotype II might be a novel symbiont for Mimosa species evolved in China.
